revised_title: Elliptically Polarized Light and Reflection: A Study of Optical Phenomena
tldr: This article investigates the behavior of light that is elliptically polarized by reflection, particularly near the polarizing angle. The author develops a mathematical framework to describe the displacement of the medium and its curl in the case of reflection from an isotropic transparent substance. The study focuses on the optical properties of substances like diamond and realgar, comparing experimental results with theoretical predictions.
